body.p: Postdoctoral Researcher • Galaxy Formation and Evolution

img.p: I am a postdoctoral researcher modeling galaxies for future surveys, such as Roman, with a focus on accurate modeling of emission lines and calibrating models using the Semi-Analytic Model Galacticus. My other research interests are modeling dwarf satellites of the Milky Way and Centaurus A, and exploring the impact of major mergers on stellar streams and their properties.

Using the GALACTICUS semi-analytic model, I have implemented an improved model for emission line luminosities in HII regions, incorporating the Cloudy models, building upon the model by Merson et al. 2018 for star-forming galaxies. I have implemented an emission line model for the AGN in model galaxies, drawing inspiration from the work of Feltre et al. 2016 \cite{Feltre+2016}. This model employs \texttt{CLOUDY} Ferland+2013, Ferland+2017, to create detailed photoionization models of the narrow-line regions in AGN.

img.h3: Dwarf Galaxies of the Local Volume (Weerasooriya et al. 2023,2024)
img.p: My Ph.D. thesis began exploration of the dependence of the SF physics of dwarf galaxies on the environment by modeling dwarf galaxies of the MW and an intermediate mass-environment (Cen A) using \texttt{Galacticus}. SAMs formulate galaxy physics onto a dark matter-only N-body simulation, are computationally inexpensive, and allow us to explore this massive system's parameter space rapidly.
